article_title: Anthem's $15M Deal To End ACA Switch Suits Nears OK
article_text:
Anthem's $15M Deal To End ACA Switch Suits Nears OK

Law360, Los Angeles (March 15, 2016, 11:29 PM ET) -- A California judge on Tuesday said he was prepared to approve, pending minor tweaks, Anthem Blue Cross' $15 million-plus deal to end four class actions alleging the insurer misled hundreds of thousands of consumers about their coverage when they switched to Affordable Care Act-compliant health plans.



At a hearing on the plaintiffs’ motion for preliminary settlement approval, Los Angeles Superior Court Judge Elihu M. Berle told the parties that he just needed to see some small corrections to the $14.9 million deal, which could grow, before...

To view the full article, register now.
